definition: than, relative to, with respect to, in comparison with
building (a structure with a roof and walls)
block, rectangular prism (a solid geometric object)
button, key (an input device which is pressed)
by, with, by means of, using, through
on something, on top of, supported by
act (like something), perform (as something), behave as, pose as
show, display, point out, draw attention to, demonstrate, indicate, reveal
defend (something/someone), protect, guard, keep safe, save, preserve, conserve
identify (something), recognize, be familiar with, discern
day (either 24 hours or the period of sunlight)
depend (on something), be controlled or determined by
does, (makes the sentence a question; optional, removes ambiguity)
do (something), perform (an action), be involved with, participate in
often, frequent, occupational, as a job, routinely, as the primary purpose, as a tool for
find, come to know where something is, discover
focus (on something), pay attention to, concentrate on
for, intended for, for the purpose of, to, in favor of, so that, in order to
in a fraction, over, -th/-nd (precedes a number)
go (on a surface), travel, move oneself

antonymDefinition: disagree (with something or someone), object to, oppose
say goodbye to, bid farewell to

definition: hit (something), beat, strike, crash into, knock
during (something) (not necessarily from the start to end of)
copy (something), make one more, duplicate, multiply
cause (something), make happen, be the reason for, so, therefore
be able to do (something), be capable of, can
common, normal, usual, ordinary, regular, typical
antonymDefinition: uncommon, unusual, rare, strange, weird, odd

definition: concept, idea, notion, thought, topic, subject
care about (something), have concern for, worry about, respect
extent, degree, amount, quantity (used for uncountable items or actions)
be equal to, be the same as, be identical to
control (something), drive, manipulate, rule, conduct, lead
could (the verb could happen), may, might, perhaps, maybe; possible
long, with a great length, tall
large, big, great, high (of an amount)
outlet (for electricity or another resource), spout, dispenser, faucet
level (of a game, building, etc), stage, layer, shelf
limb, appendage, neck, arm, leg, branch
limit, constraint, the maximum permissible amount
to the left of, on the left side of
antonymDefinition: to the right of, on the right side of

definition: loop, a shape which has no end
light, either light itself or a light producing source
mollusk, soft-bellied creature, snail, octopus, squid
make (something), create, produce, cause to exist, build, construct; give birth to
mail, letter (to be sent as mail)
member, an individual in a group
more, -er, to a greater extent ("long" becomes "longer")
-est, to the greatest extent, most ("long" becomes "longest")
move (something), cause to go, cause to travel
knob, handle, for holding or for opening a door
not (makes a word false); no (in response to a question)
nature, phenomena not made by man
instead (of something), in place of, rather than
only, alone, by oneself, without anything else, without the assistance or company of other people; with no other action, with no other quality; in no other place
number, quantity, amount (used for countable items)
near, close to, around, along, within a small distance
part, piece, component, section, division, region
pick (an option), choose, decide, select, vote for
place, position, region, area, location, point
predict (something), expect, infer, assume, conclude, estimate, judge, guess
problem, conflict, issue, drama, trouble, puzzle, challenge, flaw
push, apply a force, press, squeeze
arthropod, animal with exoskeleton, insect, crustacean, bug
rail, track (for holding or for trains)
ranked, having a place in an order, -st/-nd/-rd/-th (a number will follow, used for ordinal numerals)
rest (on something), lie, lay down, take a break, relax
self, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, themselves, yourself, yourselves (causes the verb to be reflexive, refers to the subject of the containing clause)
say (something), speak, talk, tell, communicate, state
space, void, gap, vacuum (the absence of anything)
straight, direct, extending or moving in one direction only, literal
start, beginning, the start of an object or span
antonymDefinition: end, the end of an object or span

definition: stay (in a group), remain, continue to be
not moving, still, static; still true
suggest (to do something), advise, direct, instruct, guide, lead
some, a, an, a particular instance of (previously unmentioned)
suppose (that something is true), have an opinion, think that, believe
switch (for making and breaking a circuit)
seem like (something), appear to be, look like
change (something), make different, modify, alter, transform, edit
true, in fact, did, indeed; yes (in response to a question)
time, period, moment (either a specific point or a span)
taper (to a point), gradually become narrow until converging, be sharp toward
check, inspect, see the status of something

antonymDefinition: avoid, refrain from, keep away from, flee

definition: turn (something), rotate, change the orientation of, aim, roll, spin
too, excessive, to too much of an extent
to, towards, in the direction of
(modifies a word to the opposite of its meaning)
as, to a certain extent, so
angle, degree measure, corner, joint, hinge
very, to a great extent, quite
antonymDefinition: a little, a bit, not much, slight

definition: visit, be a guest at, tour
of, originating from, possessed by, related to
want, wish for, hope for, seek, dream of
whether (expresses the truth of a situation noun)
while, during, for, for the duration of, from the start to the end of
wave (something), move back and forth, swing
way, method, means, manner, mode, fashion
will, going to (causes a verb to be in the future tense); happening in the future
which, whom (extracts the direct or prepositional object from a situation noun so that the object takes the place of the situation noun in the parent clause)
win (a competition), be victorious in, succeed at
which, who (extracts the subject from a situation noun so that the subject takes the place of the situation noun in the parent clause)
was, -ed (causes a verb to be in the past tense)

antonymDefinition: off, inactive, dormant, not doing anything

definition: thick (large in the tertiary direction), fat
